src:
Pemohon SKCK Melonjak, Polres Jaksel: 50 Persen Untuk CPNS
07 Nov 2019, 06:32 by Antara, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Jumlah pemohon pembuatan Surat Keterangan Catatan Kepolisian atau SKCK di Kepolisian Resor Metro Jakarta Selatan mengalami peningkatan menjelang pembukaan pendaftaran CPNS 2019. Karena itu, polisi pun menambah jumlah petugas pelayanan.
"Untuk mempercepat pencetakan SKCK dan mempersingkat waktu tunggu kita tambah jumlah petugas," kata Kepala Urusan Administrasi dan Ketatausahaan Satuan Intelijen Keamanan Polres Metro Jakarta Selatan, Inspektur Dua Oki Aji Ismoyo kepada Antara saat dikonfirmasi di Jakarta, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Oki mengatakan total ada lima petugas yang melayani permohonan SKCK setiap tahun. Dengan adanya lonjakan pemohon penerbitan SKCK, jumlah petugas ditambah menjadi tujuh orang.
Menurut Oki, lonjakan jumlah pemohon penerbitan SKCK mengalami peningkatan sejak dua pekan terakhir. Dalam kondisi normal, pelayanan SKCK menerima 100 pemohon setiap harinya.
Sejak dua pekan terakhir hingga tiga hari terakhir ini, jumlah pemohon meningkat antara 200 sampai 300 orang per harinya. Permohonan SKCK sebanyak 50 persen adalah untuk keperluan pendaftaran Calon Pegawai Negeri Sipil (CPNS) tahun 2019.
Selain itu, pemohon datang dari pegawai kontrak pemerintah kota yang ingin memperpanjang kontrak kerjanya.
Oki mengatakan layanan penerbitan SKCK dapat dilakukan dalam waktu tunggu sekitar 10 menit sudah bisa diterbitkan. "Dalam kondisi normal jika berkas lengkap," kata dia.
Salah satu pemohon SKCK, Reza, 23 tahun mengatakan baru pertama kali mengurus pembuatan SKCK untuk melengkapi pendaftaran CPNS 2019. Menurut dia, proses pembuatan SKCK tidak memakan waktu lama asalkan berkas yang diperlukan lengkap.
Reza mengatakan proses yang membuat lama menunggu adalah proses pengambilan legalisir SKCK. "Enggak lama sih, tadi saya cuma 30 menit udah selesai. Cuma yang lama ini nunggu legalisirnya," kata dia.
Menurut Reza, lumrah jika setiap ada pendaftaran CPNS jumlah pemohon SKCK di kepolisian membludak sehingga perlu sediakan waktu lebih awal agar cepat dilayani. "Biar tidak kelamaan nunggu datang aja lebih awal, berkas disiapkan kalau sudah lengkap tinggal daftar, lebih cepat kalau daftar online," ujarnya.
text:
SKCK Applicants Soaring, South Jakarta Police Precinct: 50 Percent for CPNS
Nov 7 2019, 06:32 by Antara, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The number of applicants making Certificate of Police Records or SKCK in the South Jakarta Metro Police Department has increased towards the opening of the registration of CPNS 2019. Therefore, the police also increased the number of service officers.
"To speed up the printing of the SKCK and shorten the waiting time we increase the number of officers," said Head of Administration and Administration of the South Jakarta Metro Police Security Intelligence Unit, Second Inspector Oki Aji Ismoyo to Antara when confirmed in Jakarta, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
Oki said there were a total of five officers serving SKCK applications every year. With the surge of applicants issuing SKCK, the number of officers was increased to seven.
According to Oki, the surge in the number of SKCK issuance applicants has increased since the last two weeks. Under normal conditions, the SKCK service receives 100 applicants every day.
Since the last two weeks to the last three days, the number of applicants has increased between 200 to 300 people per day. Application for SKCK as much as 50 percent is for the purpose of registering 2019 Civil Servant Candidates (CPNS).
In addition, applicants come from city government contract employees who want to extend their work contracts.
Oki said that the SKCK issuance service can be done within a waiting time of around 10 minutes and can be issued. "Under normal conditions if the file is complete," he said.
One of the SKCK applicants, Reza, 23, said that it was the first time he was taking care of making SKCK to complete the registration of CPNS 2019. According to him, the SKCK making process did not take long as long as the required documents were complete.
Reza said that the process that made the long wait was the process of taking the SKCK legalization. "It's not long, I just finished 30 minutes. Only this long wait for the legalization," he said.
According to Reza, it is common for every CPNS registration to have a booming number of SKCK applicants in the police, so it is necessary to allow time to be served quickly. "So, don't wait too long to arrive early, the file is prepared if the list is complete, just register faster," he said.
